content.webTitle: Tom Dyckhoff: Let's move to Kensington Palace Gardens, London W8

fields.headline: Let's move to ...
fields.bodyText: Not unless you're the kind of chaps who have a serious case of, ahem, security equipment in a safe on your premises and/or serious interests in some Caspian Sea oil fields. Ups Aka Millionaire's Row. Aka the most expensive street in Britain. Aka London's original gated community. All the security a Russian oligarch can get, five minutes from Kensington High Street. Downs Serious money doesn't make for a low-key address. And did I mention the house prices? Getting around Something black and bulletproof. (The cleaners can come to work via Kensington High Street and Queensway tube stations.) Schools Fox Primary 'very good', says Ofsted. Holland Park secondary 'satisfactory'. As if you're really going state. Property You'll need ready cash (seven figures double plus) and patience. Barely two dozen seriously posh residences mean few sales. Last year, steel magnate Lakshmi Mittal spent a reported £70m on Bernie Eccleston's 12-bedroom, 20-car-garage mansion. Posher Guardian readers might just afford the three-bed flats: £3.5m-plus, four years ago. Make Knight Frank in Kensington your friend (020-7937 8203).
